subject: p12952223
Findings: In comparison with the study of, there is little overall change in the appearance of the heart and lungs. Continued low lung volumes with bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis with some elevation of pulmonary venous pressure. In the appropriate clinical setting, supervening pneumonia would have to be considered. There has been removal of the right chest tube with no evidence of pneumothorax. The intestinal tube has also been removed.
